publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5723 Chris Ballance: Creative Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates this year’s winners of the Scottish Arts Council Creative Scotland Awards: Peter Arnott (Glasgow), Henry Coombes (Glasgow), Linda Cracknell (Aberfeldy, Perthshire), Jonathan Falla (Cupar, Fife), Kenny Hunter (Glasgow), John Maxwell Geddes (Glasgow), May Miles Thomas (Edinburgh), Tom Pow (Dumfries), Ross Sinclair (Helensburgh, Dunbartonshire) and Simon Yuill (Glasgow); recognises that Scotland’s artists were at the vanguard of the campaign for a Scottish Parliament, and celebrates the breadth and diversity of creative talent in Scotland today.

S2M-5723 Chris Ballance: Creative Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates this year’s winners of the Scottish Arts Council Creative Scotland Awards: Peter Arnott (Glasgow), Henry Coombes (Glasgow), Linda Cracknell (Aberfeldy, Perthshire), Jonathan Falla (Cupar, Fife), Kenny Hunter (Glasgow), John Maxwell Geddes (Glasgow), May Miles Thomas (Edinburgh), Tom Pow (Dumfries), Ross Sinclair (Helensburgh, Dunbartonshire) and Simon Yuill (Glasgow); recognises that Scotland’s artists were at the vanguard of the campaign for a Scottish Parliament, and celebrates the breadth and diversity of creative talent in Scotland today. Supported by: Tricia Marwick*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Rob Gibson*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Dr Elaine Murray*
S2M-5723 Creative Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2007) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Jackie Baillie*, Bill Butler*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-5723 Creative Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2007) Fergus Ewing*
S2M-5723 Creative Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2007) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5723 Creative Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2007) Frances Curran*
S2M-5723 Creative Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2007) Cathy Peattie*

S2M-5723 Chris Ballance: Creative Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates this year’s winners of the Scottish Arts Council Creative Scotland Awards: Peter Arnott (Glasgow), Henry Coombes (Glasgow), Linda Cracknell (Aberfeldy, Perthshire), Jonathan Falla (Cupar, Fife), Kenny Hunter (Glasgow), John Maxwell Geddes (Glasgow), May Miles Thomas (Edinburgh), Tom Pow (Dumfries), Ross Sinclair (Helensburgh, Dunbartonshire) and Simon Yuill (Glasgow); recognises that Scotland’s artists were at the vanguard of the campaign for a Scottish Parliament, and celebrates the breadth and diversity of creative talent in Scotland today. Supported by: Tricia Marwick, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mr Mark Ruskell, Rob Gibson, Eleanor Scott, Patrick Harvie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Jackie Baillie, Bill Butler, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Maureen Watt, Fergus Ewing, Donald Gorrie, Frances Curran, Cathy Peattie
